text:
Had the same problem with v2.0.49. It seems to be caused by long periods of
inactivity - the connections to the LDAP server time out, and are never reconnected.

Have just tested the latest auth_ldap module for CVS HEAD, and the problem seems
to have gone away. Please could you test and confirm if it works for you?

The easiest way to test this is to drop in the *ldap*.c files from CVS head (or
latest snapshot) into the modules/experimental directory, and try it out with
v2.0.49.

creator: minfrin@sharp.fm
text:
Please try the patch at http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27748
and tell me if it fixes this problem. This patch has been applied to v2.1.0-dev,
and awaits backporting to v2.0.50-dev.

An additional note on this: The error "User is not unique" will happen if a
search for a user matches more than one entry.

Within the code, finding zero users, or finding two or more users will return
"No such object".

Can you check whether the person with the auth problem is not duplicated within
your LDAP server?
